db:abstract.db:para: The QSqlError class provides SQL database error information.

db:listitem.db:para: QSqlError is part of Database Classes

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A QSqlError object can provide database-specific error data, including the driverText() and databaseText() messages (or both concatenated together as text()), and the nativeErrorCode() and type().

db:section.db:title: enum QSqlError::ErrorType
db:section.db:para: This enum type describes the context in which the error occurred, e.g., a connection error, a statement error, etc.

db:section.db:title: QSqlError::QSqlError(const QString &driverText = QString(), const QString &databaseText = QString(), QSqlError::ErrorType type = NoError, const QString &code = QString())
db:section.db:para: Constructs an error containing the driver error text driverText, the database-specific error text databaseText, the type type and the error code code.

db:section.db:title: QSqlError::QSqlError(const QSqlError &other)
db:section.db:para: Creates a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QSqlError::~QSqlError()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the object and frees any allocated resources.

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlError::databaseText() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text of the error as reported by the database. This may contain database-specific descriptions; it may be empty.

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlError::driverText() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text of the error as reported by the driver. This may contain database-specific descriptions. It may also be empty.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlError::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if an error is set, otherwise false.
Example:

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlError::nativeErrorCode() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the database-specific error code, or an empty string if it cannot be determined.

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlError::text() const
db:section.db:para: This is a convenience function that returns databaseText() and driverText() concatenated into a single string.

db:section.db:title: QSqlError::ErrorType QSqlError::type() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the error type, or -1 if the type cannot be determined.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlError::operator!=(const QSqlError &other) const
db:section.db:para: Compare the other error's values to this error and returns true if it is not equal.

db:section.db:title: QSqlError &QSqlError::operator=(const QSqlError &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns the other error's values to this error.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlError::operator==(const QSqlError &other) const
db:section.db:para: Compare the other error's values to this error and returns true, if it equal.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QSqlError
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QSqlError are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] QSqlError::QSqlError(const QString &driverText, const QString &databaseText, QSqlError::ErrorType type, int number)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Constructs an error containing the driver error text driverText, the database-specific error text databaseText, the type type and the optional error number number.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] int QSqlError::number() const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Returns the database-specific error number, or -1 if it cannot be determined.
Returns 0 if the error code is not an integer.

db:warning.db:para: Some databases use alphanumeric error codes, which makes number() unreliable if such a database is used.

db:section.db:para: Use nativeErrorCode() instead

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] void QSqlError::setDatabaseText(const QString &databaseText)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Sets the database error text to the value of databaseText.
Use QSqlError(const QString &driverText, const QString &databaseText, ErrorType type, int number) instead

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] void QSqlError::setDriverText(const QString &driverText)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Sets the driver error text to the value of driverText.
Use QSqlError(const QString &driverText, const QString &databaseText, ErrorType type, int number) instead

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] void QSqlError::setNumber(int number)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Sets the database-specific error number to number.
Use QSqlError(const QString &driverText, const QString &databaseText, ErrorType type, int number) instead

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] void QSqlError::setType(QSqlError::ErrorType type)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Sets the error type to the value of type.
Use QSqlError(const QString &driverText, const QString &databaseText, ErrorType type, int number) instead
